MajorClaims.Text: standardized tests are valuable option for educational system as long as it would help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge
schools which obligate their students to take standardized tests are right

Claims.Text: these schools can qualitatively check if they are giving an appropriate education to their students
schools should require students to take standardized tests, as long as this option helps to both sides
requirement to take standardized tests is the right choice

Premises.Text: exams could be the only way for teachers to see the real abilities of those students
some students are not so active on the lessons, cause they are already familiar with the issue
many teachers rely only on the exam results while grading the class
the usage of standardized tests is the superior option for them
some students may get used to simply rewriting solved problems from the blackboard
they will never try to solve problems on their own
standardized tests offer them such chance
standardized tests can be good chance for students to apply their knowledge on practice
in this case teachers can compare the level of knowledge of different students
In any class there will be students who will show low academic performance, so teachers could work with them more intensively
standardized tests are required over those who don’t
if the teacher would know the level of each student he would fairly share his time to all of them
they help teachers to fairly grade the students
